headline: Javier Palomarez, USHBC President & CEO, Welcomes Cynthia Stopani as Newest Member of Advisory Board
summary: WASHINGTON, Feb. 25, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The United States Hispanic Business Council (USHBC) has been recognized as one of the leading advocates for the small business community. As part of this advocacy, the USHBC maintains a growing board of advisors that inform decisions, strategy and operations. headline: Consumer Staples Are Up Almost 20% While the S&P 500 Struggles. Retirees Are Paying Attention.
summary: Consumer sentiment has been sitting in recessionary territory for months, with the University of Michigan’s index at 56.4 as of January 2026 and the S&P 500 up just 0.81% year-to-date. That combination is exactly the environment where defensive funds like KXI have historically demonstrated their characteristics. What KXI Is Actually Built to Do KXI tracks ... headline: KXI Is Anchored by Dividend Kings That Quietly Returned 18% This Year
summary: KXI pays a 2.2% dividend yield by owning shares in the world’s most recognizable consumer staples companies, passing that income through to investors each quarter. With nearly 20 years of operating history and a portfolio built around household names, it has earned a reputation as a conservative income vehicle for retirees. But a 2.2% yield ... headline: Protein Pop Launches Protein Pop Plus at Costco Nationwide
summary: Rise Wellness announced the expansion of its Protein Pop offering with the launch of Protein Pop Plus, a new carbonated, ready‑to‑drink clear protein beverage now available at all 607 Costco locations across the United States. Protein Pop Plus builds on the success of the brand's original Protein Pop line, offering consumers a bold new way to enjoy high‑protein nutrition in a refreshing, carbonated format.

headline: Citi Raises Costco (COST) Price Target to $1,000 from $990
summary: We recently published an article titled 12 Best Retail Stocks to Buy According to Analysts. On February 20, Costco Wholesale Corporation (NASDAQ:COST) saw Citi analyst Steven Zaccone raise the firm’s price target to $1,000 from $990 while maintaining a Neutral rating, citing a modest same-store sales and earnings beat in fiscal second-quarter results.
